reference: Volume Three, Issue Thirty-five, File 10 of 13
title: Phrack World News
historical_context: This issue reflects the hacker culture of the early 1990s, highlighting events and trends in the telecommunications and hacking communities.
short_summary: This edition of Phrack World News covers various significant stories, including the announcement of Xmascon 1991, a major telecommunications conference, and highlights from the hacker community, including notable incidents and emerging technologies.
summary:
In this edition of Phrack World News, Dispater compiles a variety of important stories from the hacking and telecommunications world. The highlight is the announcement of Xmascon 1991, a conference aimed at bringing together hackers, journalists, and security personnel to discuss pressing issues in computer security. The event promises a diverse range of speakers and topics, emphasizing the importance of community engagement in the evolving landscape of telecommunications. The conference is positioned as a unique opportunity for networking and learning, urging attendees not to miss out on this significant gathering.

Additionally, the issue touches on various incidents within the hacker community, including the arrest of a student involved in a large-scale phone fraud scheme and the entrepreneurial ventures of former hackers transitioning into the virtual reality space. These stories illustrate the dynamic nature of the hacker culture during this period, showcasing both the risks and innovations emerging from the underground. The overall tone encourages readers to remain vigilant and engaged in the ongoing discourse surrounding computer security and the implications of hacking in society.
